sgcool_label_text:\This plaque was built by former British servicemen in memory of the founder of the Sandes Soldiers Home in Singapore
 Miss Kathleen Leslie Symes. The Home
 orignally located at Portsdown Road where The Temasek Club used to be
 was opened in 1949. With facilities such as a swimming pool
 canteen
 tennis courts and a billiards room
 the Home provided a recreational space for British servicemen to relax and to get together with their family while they were on leave. Built on the premise of a \\home away from home\\ \This plaque was built by former British servicemen in memory of the founder of the Sandes Soldiers Home in Singapore
 Miss Kathleen Leslie Symes. The Home
 orignally located at Portsdown Road where The Temasek Club used to be
 was opened in 1949. With facilities such as a swimming pool

 tennis courts and a billiards room
 the Home provided a recreational space for British servicemen to relax and to get together with their family while they were on leave. Built on the premise of a \\home away from home\\

metadata.sgcool_label_text: "This plaque was built by former British servicemen in memory of the founder of the Sandes Soldiers Home in Singapore, Miss Kathleen Leslie Symes. The Home, orignally located at Portsdown Road where The Temasek Club used to be, was opened in 1949. With facilities such as a swimming pool, canteen, tennis courts and a billiards room, the Home provided a recreational space for British servicemen to relax and to get together with their family while they were on leave. Built on the premise of a ""home away from home"" "This plaque was built by former British servicemen in memory of the founder of the Sandes Soldiers Home in Singapore, Miss Kathleen Leslie Symes. The Home, orignally located at Portsdown Road where The Temasek Club used to be, was opened in 1949. With facilities such as a swimming pool, canteen, tennis courts and a billiards room, the Home provided a recreational space for British servicemen to relax and to get together with their family while they were on leave. Built on the premise of a ""home away from home""
